content.html:
Cool Down 5 min

Student Activity

For each expression, write an equivalent expression in standard form. Show your reasoning.

  1. \((2x+5)(x+1)\)

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Answer: \(2x^2+7x+5\). The diagram shows that\((2x+5)(x+1)=2x \cdot x+2x \cdot 1+5 \cdot x+5 \cdot 1\). Adding this together gives \(2x^2+7x+5\) in standard form.


 

\(2x\)

\(5\)

\(x\)

\(2x^2\)

\(5x\)

\(1\)

\(2x\)

\(5\)

  1. \((x-2)(x+2)\)

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Answer: \(x^2-4\). \((x+2)(x-2)=x^2+(-2x)+2x+(-4)=x^2-4\). The diagram also shows that \((x+2)(x-2)=x^2-4\).


 

\(x\)

\(2\)

\(x\)

\(x^2\)

\(2x\)

\(-2\)

\(-2x\)

\(-4\)
